title: Archetypes at Rest: The Tarot in Ordinary Time
description: What happens when archetypes are stripped of their 'mystical' costumes and shown as just humans at the bus stop, in a diner, or doing laundry? Are they still divine? Are we?
pitch: What happens when archetypes are stripped of their mystical costumes and shown as just humans at the bus stop, in a diner, or doing laundry? Are they still divine? Are we?
challenge: The core challenge was to transpose these sacred, powerful archetypes into mundane settings without losing their mythic resonance, creating a delicate balance between the divine and the everyday.
development: Each piece began with extensive research into the chosen archetypes, followed by location scouting in everyday places. The goal was to find the perfect visual tension—the laundromat for Temperance, the diner for the Hierophant—that would spark a new conversation about these ancient symbols.
outcome: The result is a collection of images that invite viewers to find the tarot’s wisdom in themselves, not as distant ideals but as everyday truths. Each piece asks: Which card are you playing today?
process:
The Sacred in the Banal

The creative process for Archetypes at Rest was one of translation. It involved taking the grand, symbolic language of the tarot and finding its quiet echo in the modern world. Each composition is intentionally framed like a classical painting to elevate the scene, while the warm, glowing light suggests a universal divinity that persists even in the most ordinary moments.
inspiration:
Finding the Mythic in the Mundane

This series was inspired by the idea that our lives are already full of myth and meaning—if only we stop to see them. It explores the tension and irony of placing timeless figures in contemporary contexts: the Hierophant's authority in a fast-food booth, the Lovers' sacred choice at a noisy bar. The goal is to make these archetypes more accessible, more human, and to encourage viewers to recognize these powerful forces within their own lives.

gallery.title: The Lovers & The Devil
gallery.description: We begin at a rooftop bar. Golden light pools over two lovers leaning close, hands clasped in a silent vow. And yet — just there — the Devil smiles over his drink, a shadow at the edge of their joy. Notice the warm, seductive glow, but don’t miss the tension.

hotspots.title: A Sacred Vow
hotspots.description: Their hands clasp in a perfect heart, a symbol of their pure, intimate connection.

hotspots.title: A Quiet Temptation
hotspots.description: The Devil’s drink catches the light, a subtle and alluring temptation waiting to be acknowledged.

gallery.title: The Empress & Death
gallery.description: Next we step into a greenhouse — lush and teeming with life. The Empress waters a blossom, her belly full of promise. And yet here too is Death, kneeling calmly among the soil. Their presence together doesn’t contradict, but completes.

hotspots.title: Fertile Creation
hotspots.description: The Empress's pregnancy symbolizes creation, growth, and the persistence of life.

hotspots.title: A Gentle Partner
hotspots.description: Death is not a threat, but a quiet partner in the cycle, tending the soil from which new life will spring.

gallery.title: Temperance & The Angel
gallery.description: Now we enter a laundromat at dusk. See the muted neon and rows of washers, yet here stand two angels performing their quiet ritual of balance. One pours water between pitchers, the other cradles a glowing cloth.

hotspots.title: Perfect Harmony
hotspots.description: Water flows perfectly between the two pitchers, a symbol of finding equilibrium and harmony in a mundane task.

hotspots.title: Open Balance
hotspots.description: The neon sign above hums with a quiet instruction, elevating the domestic chore to a sacred act of care.

gallery.title: The Fool & The High Priestess
gallery.description: Onward to a subway station — tiled, quiet, and yet alive. The Fool dances, his little dog following along. Across the platform, the High Priestess sits, serene, scroll in hand, among scattered pomegranate seeds.

hotspots.title: Innocent Joy
hotspots.description: The Fool's carefree stride represents naive joy and spontaneous energy, unburdened by knowledge.

hotspots.title: Quiet Knowledge
hotspots.description: Pomegranates, symbols of inner wisdom, spill at her feet, representing knowledge kept silent and protected.

gallery.title: The Hierophant
gallery.description: Here we pause at a roadside diner. The Hierophant sits alone, a burger in hand, the sun setting beyond. Keys are etched into the diner's window, glowing faintly in the sunset.

hotspots.title: Authority at Rest
hotspots.description: His burger, a mundane meal, suggests that even ancient authority must participate in the everyday world.

hotspots.title: Lingering Symbols
hotspots.description: The keys of the Hierophant, etched into the diner window, suggest that tradition endures, even in the most secular places.

gallery.title: The Emperor & The Empress
gallery.description: In a modest living room, the Emperor reclines, orb in hand, while the Empress—wearing a polka-dot dress and crown—sweeps the floor. Power is as much care as command.

hotspots.title: Domestic Power
hotspots.description: The broom meets the crown, suggesting that care and rule are intertwined. Domesticity is reframed as its own kind of throne room.

hotspots.title: Power in Repose
hotspots.description: The ram, a symbol of the Emperor's power, sleeps peacefully at his feet, docile yet ever-present.

hotspots.title: Domain of the Empress
hotspots.description: Traditional tarot card depictions show the empress on a throne and behind her are fields of wheat, a river flowing through the landscape, and mountains. These symbolize the earth and abundance, tying the empress to crops and productivity. Here her domain is relegated to an image on a carpet, but still she tends her domain.

gallery.title: The Sun & The Moon
gallery.description: Finally, we arrive at a gas station under a moonlit sky. The Moon greets her dog as the Sun strides back laughing. These opposites are not in conflict but in harmony.

hotspots.title: Quiet Intimacy
hotspots.description: The Moon gently strokes the dog, representing a quiet, intuitive tenderness that thrives in darkness.

hotspots.title: Radiant Joy
hotspots.description: The Sun’s bright, easy smile carries warmth and vitality, a beacon of joy even in the shadow of the night.

journey.title: Temptation vs. Love
journey.description: Fade-in, slight zoom-in on bar, golden halos shimmer

journey.title: Cycles of Life & Death
journey.description: Pan up through greenhouse vines, fade to dusty soil

journey.title: Balance in the Mundane
journey.description: Parallax: laundry machines rotate subtly, neon flickers

journey.title: Innocence & Knowledge
journey.description: Scroll reveals each pillar (Boaz & Jachin), Fool dances past

journey.title: Tradition in Decline?
journey.description: Slow dolly toward diner booth, sun flares through window

journey.title: Domestic Power & Care
journey.description: Tilt-down from crown to broom in hand

journey.title: Harmony of Opposites
journey.description: Crossfade: gas station lights shift from sunlit to moonlit

specs.title: Mythic Framing
specs.description: The centrality of the figures and their interaction is often framed like a Renaissance painting, elevating everyday settings to something mythic.

specs.title: Conceptual Tension
specs.description: The pairings thrive on juxtaposition and irony, recasting traditional conflicts into contemporary choices.

specs.title: Contemporary Symbolism
specs.description: Timeless archetypes are grounded in today’s world, allowing viewers to find the sacred in the mundane.

specs.title: Narrative Lighting
specs.description: A warm, glowing palette persists even in dark or ironic scenes, suggesting the universality of archetypes.

specs.title: Interactive Details
specs.description: Small props and details serve as interactive clues, inviting viewers to read the image and uncover its meaning.

specs.title: Introspective Prompts
specs.description: The series encourages personal reflection, asking viewers to consider where these archetypes appear in their own lives.
